Parameters: The callback object that will be triggered when the panorama is ready to be used.
getStreetViewPanoramaAsync(com.google.an.Description: Sets a callback object which will be triggered when the @B_com#google#android#gms#maps#StreetViewPanorama_E@ instance is ready to be used. Note that: In the case where Google Play services is not installed on the user's device, the callback will not be triggered until the user installs it. The callback will be executed in the main thread. The @B_com#google#android#gms#maps#StreetViewPanorama_E@ object provided by the callback is non-null.

SupportStreetViewPanoramaFragment().Description: Creates a streetview panorama fragment. This constructor is public only for use by an inflater. Use @B_com#google#android#gms#maps#SupportStreetViewPanoramaFragment#newInstance_E@ to create a SupportStreetViewPanoramaFragment programmatically.

onCreateView(android.view.LayoutInflater.FullName: public View onCreateView (LayoutInflater inflater, ViewGroup container, Bundle savedInstanceState)

newInstance().Description: Creates a streetview panorama fragment, using default options.

Returns: the StreetViewPanorama. Null if the view of the fragment is not yet ready. This can happen if the fragment lifecyle have not gone through @B_com#google#android#gms#maps#SupportStreetViewPanoramaFragment#onCreateView_E@ yet. This can also happen if Google Play services is not available. If Google Play services becomes available afterwards and the fragment have gone through @B_com#google#android#gms#maps#SupportStreetViewPanoramaFragment#onCreateView_E@, calling this method again will initialize and return the StreetViewPanorama.
getStreetViewPanorama().Description: Gets the underlying StreetViewPanorama that is tied to the view wrapped by this fragment.

ClassDesc: A StreetViewPanorama component in an app. This fragment is the simplest way to place a Street View panorama in an application. It's a wrapper around a view of a panorama to automatically handle the necessary life cycle needs. Being a fragment, this component can be added to an activity's layout file simply with the XML below. @B_com#google#android#gms#maps#StreetViewPanorama_E@ must be acquired using @B_com#google#android#gms#maps#SupportStreetViewPanoramaFragment#getStreetViewPanoramaAsync_E@. The @B_com#google#android#gms#maps#SupportStreetViewPanoramaFragment_E@ automatically initializes the Street View system and the view. A view can be removed when the SupportStreetViewPanoramaFragment's @B_com#google#android#gms#maps#SupportStreetViewPanoramaFragment#onDestroyView_E@ method is called and the @B_com#google#android#gms#maps#StreetViewPanoramaOptions#useViewLifecycleInFragment_E@ option is set. When this happens the SupportStreetViewPanoramaFragment is no longer valid until the view is recreated again later when MapFragment's @B_com#google#android#gms#maps#SupportStreetViewPanoramaFragment#onCreateView_E@ method is called. Any object obtained from the @B_com#google#android#gms#maps#StreetViewPanorama_E@ is associated with the view. It's important to not hold on to objects beyond the view's life. Otherwise it will cause a memory leak as the view cannot be released. Use this class only if you are targeting API 12 and above. Otherwise, use SupportStreetViewPanoramaFragment.
